heisigComment: * Since the phrase "too much" is overly abstract, we shall take the image of a scale whose indicator spins round and round on the dial because too much weight has been set on it. It will help to use this image in learning the kanji itself.
heisigStory: Umbrella . . . potato . . . little. The last stroke of potato and the first of little coincide in this character.
koohiiStory1: You hang an umbrella upside-down on a hook of the scales and fill it with little potatoes. No luck: it weights too much.
koohiiStory2: This is the kanji for 「あまり Amari」, which means too little in negative sentences and too much in the rest (always with a negative sense). I take the liberty of using the symbol ">" (more than, another meaning!!) as the umbrella component, and using two (#2) and little (#105) for the potato primitive. So, this kanji either means "two much" (more than 2) or "two little". (thanks, Virtua_leaf and Thunderball!).
kunYomi: あま.る、あま.り、あま.す、あんま.り
readingExamples: 余す (あま.す), 余る (あま.る)
words: not very (this form only used as adverb), not much, remainder, rest, remnant, surplus, balance, excess, remains, scraps, residue, fullness, other, too much
very, greatly, much, to a large extent, quite
remainder, remnant, surplus, balance, excess, scraps, residue
remain, be left over, be too many
too much, unnecessary, abundance, surplus, excess
another place, somewhere else, strange parts
surplus, composure, margin, room, time, allowance, scope, rope
